Name: Forest Friends
Description:
Mia Mouse and her friends play hide and seek in the forest. Look through the peep holes in the forest and help Mia Mouse search! Wasn't there just a rustle behind the tree? And there are footprints in this puddle. Who could they belong to? Maybe Ronja Deer, Suri Dormouse, and the rest of the gang in the dense leafy undergrowth?

Discover Free Play and Details
In Forest Friends your child can engage with the game materials during free play. Play along! Discover the pictures on the game materials together and talk to your child about them. Ask your child what they recognize and encourage them to name things. Talk to them about which animals they have already seen or heard in the forest. And just like that you're already role playing with your child.

Game 1: Little Forest Explorers
One child gets Mia Mouse. Read out a task. The child searches for the solution. Sometimes the correct answer is visible on the outer walls, sometimes only through the peep holes. If the child can't find the correct answer, help them. Once the child has found the solution, they receive a star and place it in front of them. Mia Mouse is passed on to the next child. It's now their turn. The game is over once all 5 stars have been collected.

Game 2: Play Hide and Seek
Before starting the game, everyone may look into any two holes. Every child tries to remember which animal is where. Whoever was last in a forest goes first and moves Mia Mouse one animal tile forward in a clockwise direction. The child names the animal that they see on the tile. Now it's time to think about which hole they can see the animal through. They choose the hole they think the animal is hiding in and look through it. If right, the child can take a star from the starry sky as a reward. The game ends when all the stars have been taken from the sky. The children now stack the stars they won on top of each other. The child with the highest star stack wins.
Families: Components: Game Box Used In Play

Name: The Agile Mind
Description:
This serious game has been designed to bring to life the Agile Mindset and to help teams understanding how the mindset is different from a practice (easy stuff) and why practices and tools are just the basic steps of the journey to become an high performing team (difficult stuff).

The Agile Mind is articulated in 3 levels (Values,Principles, Practices & Tools) and is based on 6 influencers. Influencers are used to “develop” items of the 3 levels and cumulate points related to the level of mindset.

The game is for 2 to 6 players, but can be played also in teams, so it can scale easily to 20+ people.

The package is a print & play game and has all required materials:

108 custom poker cards of the main deck with 18 Values, 36 Principles and 54 Practices & Tool
54 influencers by mini-card or hexagonal tokens
18 objectives with 3 different “end of games conditions” of different lengths and intermediate goals
In the package you can find also the “calendar” variant, to add also cadenced challenges related to events in the real life of an agile team.

—description from the designer

Name: Hoppin' Garage
Description:
This game is a "cooperative draft game" in which players do not compete with each other, but cooperate with each other to achieve their respective goals. Players will become craftsmen who make different beers at each brewery and aim to complete the beer listed on the goal card.

Players are the artisans who make different beer in each brewery and aim to complete the beer on their goal card. In the process of collecting and completing your beer ingredients, you can enjoy learning all 10 major beer style tastes, raw materials, and the process of making beers.

Name: Agricola 15
Description:
Agricola 15 celebrates the 15th anniversary of Uwe Rosenberg's Agricola by packing a lot of material created since the game's debut into a single XXL box: the revised edition of the Agricola base game, the complete Artifex and Bubulcus expansion decks, promo items that were previously long gone (adapted to go with the revised edition), some novelties (and no, you don't have all the L-Deck cards yet...), and a well-organized inlay for quick set-up and storage.

In total, Agricola 15 contains 430 cards, more than 200 tokens, and more than 270 wooden components. This set is compatible with both the Farmers of the Moor expansion and the expansion for five and six players.

Name: Realm of Thraul: Stones
Description: 2-player game of strategy. Stones is a grid style board game with different colored squares defining a different type of movement. The goal of the game is to create a continuous stream of your color stones without getting stuck while accumulating more points than you opponent. Points are earned by landing on pink diamond squares; however, the pink diamond squares are also where your opponent can steal your stone and collect extra points for themselves.

Name: Burn the Festival
Description:
In Burn The Festival you will have to be the rabbit that most mess up a music festival without dying in the attempt. Or rather, without getting killed trying!

It is a card game, where you will have to get the cards with the highest scores and prevent your rivals from getting the cards with the highest scores.

Shuffle the cards and start by drawing 6 cards. The player in his turn must draw a card from the center deck and decide which card from his hand he is going to play. The opponents may, in turn, use the cards in their hands to prevent the card played from coming into play.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Sherlock Files: Vol VI – Devilish Details
Description:
Sherlock Files, vol. 6: Devilish Details includes three new confounding cases to solve.

Diagnose the cause of why a shopkeeper’s innocuous stumble led to an unlikely death. 
Discover if there’s a cure for a medieval mayor’s illness, or if he has been possessed by a demon!
Track down the truth behind a Renaissance woman’s death, and why her fingers are mysteriously dyed blue...
For each case, you will follow the clues, piece together the evidence, and then identify who did it, how, and why. 
This is a completely standalone game and does not require any other Sherlock Files games to play.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Fairmarket
Description:
Fairmarket is a gambling game for 2-6 players. The game uses the “Knotts Deck,” a unique deck from DeVere’s South Coast, in the Dew Point universe. The deck has three suits (flags, cups, and bells), and an unusual distribution of numbers: Ace through 9, then 10 through 60, and three face cards.

Players ante five coins to begin, and divide these coins into five pots in the center of the table.

Players then receive five cards and stack them in order on the table.

Round by round, players cards compete against each other, and cards in the center, to win the money in those pots.

It’s a simple and fast card game with lots of variations and plenty of action!

Name: Schnauferl und Eisenbahn
Description:
The players form two parties. Everyone puts a bet to be determined in advance into the till. Two players take over the positions of the signalmen and handle the closing and opening of the railway barriers. One party starts at C, the other at D. The players take turns rolling the die and moving. After the first throw has fallen, the work of the signalmen begins. If a straight throw (2, 4, 6) has been thrown, the strip representing the railway  is positioned on II, if odd (1, 3 , 5) is thrown, it is on I. This is to be done after each throw, and this will alternately block the blue stripe representing the country road. If the railway crossing is closed, the players have to stop till it opens again.

E-F presents a bridge on which 2 cars cannot drive side by side. If a player comes to the bridge and this is occupied by an oncoming car, he has to wait at E or F until the bridge is free. Also, no player can overtake a car moving in the same direction, but must occupy the next space behind it.

If two oncoming cars come to a stop on the same space on the road, this means a collision. The two players then have to roll the dice together. The lower throw is eliminated from the game, the other moves back 10 spaces.

Whoever reaches the opposite end of the lane first gets half the contents of the till and his party a point, and for each additional car that arrives earlier than the first car of the other party, another point. The first winner of the opposing party receives a quarter of the contents of the till. The last quarter remains in the till. The game is repeated until one party has 30 points. This party distributes the remainder in the till evenly among its members.

—user summary

Name: The Phantom: The Card Game – Stamus Contra Malum
Description:
A side-mission where the player gets the chance to unlock 6 new allies and the Jungle Patrol headquarters. This adventure is thematically suited to the adventure Diana in The Jungle Patrol, but can be played along with any The Phantom: the Card Game adventures.

Side-Missions are mini-adventure that can be played in parallel with adventure, they unlock new cards for the player and add one more thing to take care of.

—description from the designer

Name: Post Mortem LA: Death in La La Land
Description:
Post Mortem LA: Death in La La Land is a narrative mystery game inspired by the game Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.

Set in 1940’s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

This case centers around the unveiling of a new rollercoaster in La-La Land that goes tragically wrong when mayoral candidate Bradley Rideout flies right out of his seat and into Pirate Poppy’s Popcorn Stand. Is this a tragic fairground mishap or carefully planned foul play? It is up to you to figure out who is behind it is all - before you yourself become La-La Land’s next high-flying victim.

Name: Postmortem: Death Match
Description:
Lucha Muerte is a narrative mystery game inspired by SHCD.

Set in 1940’s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

The case:

The door of El Santo Niño church flies open, and two shotgun blasts resound in the hall. Horrified witnesses report a gunman wearing a red cape and mask. Now El Angel Rojo — luchador and hero of Chavez Ravine  — sits in a jail cell downtown, charged with double murder…

Name: Meer-Fahrt vor 3000 Jahren
Description:
The game is based on the following idea: A number of Greek youths and maidens intend to visit the "Island of Friendship". Each player initially receives 30 tokens, of which he pays 10 into the till. If the cash runs out during the game, each player pays in another 10 tokens. The Players take turns to roll and move. The ships depart from space A, but are immediately caught up in a storm that pushes the vessels in different directions until the player manages to get past space B or C. From then on, the ship follows the chosen direction until it finally reaches space 
A again to win the game.

If a ship comes to a green space, the player receives as many tokens from the till as his roll counted eyes. If he comes to a red space, he has to pay the same amount into the till. If a player is unable to make their payments, it means "shipwreck"; he receives a lifeboat and swaps his previous colored ship for a black one. With this he may continue to move; he is waived from paying twice if he stands on red. If he gets into payment difficulties again, this boat sinks and the player is eliminated from the game.

Scylla and Charybdis: As before, the player advances his ship by the number of columns equal to the number of eyes he rolled, but must place himself on the square of the column in question that shows the same number of eyes as his roll.
Friendship Island: In front of the island there are two squares to jump over. If unsuccessful, the attempt must be repeated the next time. If ships coming from different directions meet on the island, they share their wealth equally among themselves.
Vortex: The player stays around the circle with his ship until he comes to one of the exit spaces.

—user summary

Name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Earth – The Long Quest
Description:
As the armies of Karasu closed in on us, I remembered our past adventures in the palaces of Pajan, seeking to unmask the Oni hidden among the hosts... What I wouldn't have given for some of our old allies to come to our aid!

This expansion is primarily intended for owners of the two games Okko Chronicles - Cycle of Water and Cycle of Earth and their expansions. It aims to allow the use of part of the Cycle of Water material in the Cycle of Earth and vice versa.

This expansion provides material to use some of the Cycle of Water figures in the Cycle of Earth:

- An Identity Card for Tikku, his Initiative Card and his 8 Action Cards
- Identity card for Eiko Bashimon, her Initiative card and her 8 Action cards
- Identity card for Anko Kaori, her Initiative card and her 8 Action cards
- An Identity Card for Ninjas
- Identity Card for Oni Yama
- An Identity Card for Oni Kage

It also provides materials to use some of the Cycle of Earth miniatures in the Cycleof Water:

- An Identity card for the Bushi
- An Identity Card for the Archers
- Identity card for the Fire Faces
- An Identity Card for the Taishö
- An identity card for Mitsu Hatori

Finally, this expansion offers a great campaign using the material of the 2 previous Okko Chronicles games:

- 1 Campaign Book of 80 pages
- 1 Pajan Map
- 1 Time token, with a Day / Night side
- 20 Food / Koku counters
- 9 Reputation counters numbered from 01 to 09 (1 Execrable, 2 and 3 Doubtful, 4, 5 and 6 Uncertain, 7 and 8 Honorable and 9 Excellent) 
- 6 Bashimon Clan counters (or cards), with the same front side but 3 corrupted Clan sides and 3 uncorrupted Clan sides
- 12 Object cards
- 1 calendar card

The campaign book is based on the campaign "Adventure in Pajan" available for free on BGG. It will be largely modified and completed in order to integrate the scenarios of the Earth Cycle and to allow an even greater immersion in the Pajan universe. This booklet allows to link a large number of unpublished scenarios or spread in the different boxes and extensions of the Water Cycle and Earth Cycle to create a huge campaign using more than 50 different scenarios and quests.

In the course of their adventure, Heroes will travel across much of the empire, from the cold city of the Silver Silks to the azure seas of the south to the snowy mountains of the 7 Monasteries range. Depending on the circumstances, their choices, their successes (or failures), the sequence of scenarios will be completely different, allowing for a unique adventure.

Name: Gloom of Kilforth: Promo Pack 1
Description:
First offered during the Call of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game Kickstarter, 
this pack consists of Gloom of Kilforth: Tears of Kilforth Promo Cards (Encounter: Badlands (T1); Encounter: Mountain (T2); Encounter: Forest (T3)) and Shadows of Kilforth: Shadows of Pay Promo Cards a.k.a. Kilforth's Pay (Encounter: Ally (SEP1); Encounter: Badlands (SEP2); Encounter: Plains (SEP3)).

Name: Reise durch Schlaraffien
Description:
After everyone has agreed on the amount of the bet, the order is determined by rolling the die. Since laziness is trumps in the Land of Cockaigne, the last ones naturally go first, that is, whoever has the lowest number of points begins. Those who have thrown an even number of eyes are assigned the right ribbon, the others the left, after which the game begins.

The players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawn. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 31 wins the Game.

—user summary

Name: Wild: Serengeti – Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
Description:
Four Promo cards (62x87mm) from the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter: 2 Scene cards and 2 Specialist cards with Dice Tower personalities.

The two Specialists cards are:
The Content Creator (Tom Vasel) lets you start the game with an additional 2 coins and 3 VFX tokens.
The Influencer (Mark Streed) lets you gain 2 points each time you use a Food token.

The two Scene cards are:

    175 Adjacency Scene - “To protect her cubs from predators, jackals move their litter every few weeks.” - 4 VP for Hyena on water adjacent to Jackal. 



    176 Straight-Line Scene - “Leopards are very solitary creatures, spending most of their time alone.” - Leopard <-> Zebra <-> Crocodile on grass

Name: Mascarade: Gamer Promo Card
Description:
A promo card that adds the Gamer mask into the deck.

The rules for it are as follows:

Take 3 Coins from the Bank and hide 1, 2, or 3 of them in your hand.

Then choose another player who must guess how many Coins are in your hand.

If the player guesses correctly, they gain those Coins.

If their guess is wrong, add these Coins to your wealth.

Any remaining Coins (that you didn’t hide in your hand)
are put back in the Bank.

Name: Segel-Regatta
Description:
The players choose a game master (GM) who accepts the registrations, raffles the starting places, directs the races and manages the till. The tools required are: 4 cruiser yachts (A), 4 racing yachts (B), 1 escort steamer (C) for the game master, 1 black and 1 white die and a large number of tokens.

It is at the discretion of the GM to organize races for cruiser yachts or races for racing yachts. The stake for the former is 20, for the latter 10 tokens. If more than 4 participants register for a race, preliminary races will be held; only the first and second winning boats take part in the main race. If there are still more than 4 participants, further elimination races are held.

The fairway for the yachts is marked by the colors yellow, red, green and blue, in addition, the white gully to the right of it is also part of the legal fairway.

The white die is used to advance on the track. On the roll of 3 or 6, the yacht goes straight ahead, with a roll of 2 or 5  the same number of spaces in the next right fairway, on 1 and 4 the number of spaces forward in the next left fairway.

If two yachts land on the same square, the one that is in the wrong fairway is eliminated from the race. If both meet in the wrong fairway, the one that is furthest away from its rightful fairway is eliminated. Furthermore, whoever comes off the racetrack, is eliminated too.

Any participant who believes that he is in danger of being eliminated may turn up on his lawful fairway as soon as it is his turn to throw the dice. He reports this intention to the GM, uses the black die and moves back as many squares as he rolls in the next fairway against his legal fairway. For each roll of the black die, 3 tokens must be paid into the till.

The goal has been reached if the player rolls at least one eye more than there are still spaces left up to the end line.

—user summary

Name: Meadow: Seal Promo Card
Description:
Promo card of the support the dice tower 2022 kickstarter. One seal card.

The seal card requires the rock and sand ground symbols and is worth 2 points. It will show the predator card symbol.

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Spider-Ham Hero Pack
Description:
Greetings, citizens! You’ve met high-flying heroes, super-genius scientists, and cosmic sorcerers. You’ve seen awe-inspiring Avengers, grandstanding Guardians, and wondrous Web-Warriors. Now, it’s time for the porcine powerhouse, the spectacular super-pig, the wacky web-slinger, the one and only…Spider-Ham! This cartoon wonder WHAMs his way into players’ games of Marvel Champions: The Card Game with zany aplomb. Utilizing his wacky cartoon physics and goofy antics, Spider-Ham can take hits like a champ and thwart villains’ schemes with all sorts of colorful nonsense. With this Hero Pack, players will find Spider-Ham, his fifteen signature cards, and a full assortment of Justice cards inviting them to ruin the villains’ plans. This pack also includes a bonus modular encounter set featuring the iconic and terrifying Inheritors.

For players ready to challenge the Sinister Six, they can get started with the Spider-Ham Hero Pack! This expansion comes with a 40-card pre-built deck, giving players the chance to start playing right out of the box.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: A Little Dinghy
Description:
You have just been made captain of the failing merchant ship Cat o’ Nine Sails. Congratulations! Unfortunately, you may have celebrated too much; you have a series of deliveries due all over the archipelago in a few short days, and in your revelry you managed to destroy your only set of maps. You need to figure out where you are headed, and fast, or else… well, the previous captain did not exactly retire.

In A Little Dinghy, one or two players work together to re-build a map and plot a successful trade route. Each turn, one player must add a card to the map, making sure to obey certain restrictions. Once all cards have been placed, the players must be able to trace a trade route across all the islands in the map that doesn't cross over itself. There is, however, one catch; the players must keep all cards in their hands at all times, including the map itself. If a player ever lets a card drop, they immediately lose the game. If players can build the map successfully and plot out their trade route, they win the game!

In addition to the base game, A Little Dinghy comes with nine scenarios that add unique rules and challenges to the game, and a career mode that can be used to chain multiple games into a campaign.

—description from the designer

Name: The Battle of Dunstop Castle
Description:
Dunstop Castle is of course that fortress at the northwest portion of your Dragon Pass map in the Lunar Empire next to Jaldon's Wrong River at the end of the road from Goldedge. In a major offensive by the Sartar, Dunstop had to be taken within three days. Did they succeed? We're not sure, the history is vague on this point. What we have done is set up the situation as it was for you to find out what may have happened. You can play it out and decide for yourself whether the Sartar succeeded in taking Dunstop before finally being driven out by the superior army from Furthest.

--publisher description

A small-format two mapsheet game of fantasy combat in, around, and under Castle Dunstop. The game is 22 turns long, which includes daytime and nighttime turns. The winner is the player whose forces occupy the inner tower of the castle at the end of the game.

Set in the Glorantha realm and inspired by the rules of White Bear & Red Moon. Published in the Wyrm's Footnotes newsletter, issue #3.

--user summary
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Supply Chain the card game
Description:
A combination of Tetris, rummy, Sim City, and dominos. Buy properties and build your business empire. But make sure all your suppliers are linked, or it can all fall apart.

You can play a solo game, or competing against others, or play co-op.  There are over 200 cards with over 150 of those being unique.

Each player starts with a main office and a family business. Players buy, sell, and trade properties to grow a sprawling cityscape.  All cards have links so you may connect a producer with its suppliers.  Watch out for run-down derelict properties that your competitors might stick on you.

When all the properties are gone, the game is over. Players add up their victory points to determine the winner.  Different properties vary in point values.  An iron mine might have only 1 VP while the coveted Department Store has 10 VP.

—description from the designer

Name: Von der Erdenscheybe
Description:
Von der Erdenscheybe is a four-player version of Kosakenschubsen, the hand-crafted finger flicking game by Dieter Zander from Historische Spiele Zander, published at Essen Spiel 2012. All 4 participants play against each other. Again, it's about pushing the opponents off the board and trying to get to the middle of the game by advancing and thus winning. However, the board is designed in a completely different way: You now have a square board, which has a slope in the middle and ups and downs distributed over the board, creating natural "safety bunkers". In the beginning you can only hit the outermost discs of your neighbors directly, for everything else you have to make use of the round peg in the center of the board, and cleverly and accurately calculate the rebound.

—user summary

Name: Vindication: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
Description:
Two promo cards ("Monocle of the Illustrious" and "Adornment of the Patriarch") which were available as a reward for the 2022 Dice Tower Kickstarter.

Monocle of the Illustrious (Loot): Dilute 1 Power.

Adornment of the Patriarch (Relic): Return 1 influence from this card and a compansion, gain +1 speed this turn.

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Smell like a Monster
Description:
Four Monstrous Air Fresheners that can have your car, boat, RV, inner sanctum, byakhee, or hovercraft smelling fresh as the day it was made/summoned.

Not only do these smell great, but you can also use them in your games of Cthulhu Wars.

Naturally you can use these Air Fresheners as special fragrant additions in Cthulhu Wars! Just download their Loyalty Cards and find a standee! Remember: there is always space for more Cthulhu Wars]!

(Standee bases not included, neither was playtesting.)

This is a one-time only event that runs from April 1, 2022, through Midnight April 4.

Name: Cosmic Convoy
Description:
“The computer is going berserk, Captain! Our charges are exhausted, and we need to collect new ones, but the computers starting to spit out random code. I'm worried that it’s going to shoot us off the ship if we go to collect the new charges from the generators.

This was supposed to be a simple delivery! Who designed this ship?!?!”

Construct your ship using the deck and collect all of your charges (crystals or cubes)  using your crew(meeples) before the modules of your ship flip; possibly sending your charges and crew into space.

Can you recharge the engines and get your crew home safely?

—description from the designer

Name: Seven Ravens
Description:
A fairly simple abstract strategy game for two with a Nordic feel, which combines elements of hnefatafl and chess.  Stated to be a traditional folk game with rules handed down in the family, when marketed online, but it appears not to have been previously recorded.

Played on a square wooden board, divided into 7×7 undifferentiated squares (the game can also be played on an 8×8 chess board).

One player takes 6 light / natural coloured discs, termed ravens, and sets them up in one corner of the board, one in the very corner, another in each of the adjacent squares, and the remaining three in the squares adjacent to those.  The opponent takes six dark / stained discs, and similarly sets them up in the opposite corner.  Each player's specially marked disc, termed Odin's Raven, is placed at the head of this flock.  Players then take turns in moving one of their ravens, with the aim of winning the game by capturing all of the opposing ravens.
Odin's raven moves like a knight in chess, and captures by landing on an opposing disc. Other ravens move like chess rooks, and capture by flanking an opposing disc, as in hnefatafl.  Odin's raven may also participate in these flanking captures.
There are several slight variants with differing movement / capturing rules.

Name: Roma aeterna
Description:
Roma aeterna is a strategic game for four players aged 14 and over with a historical background.

The game is based on the eventful history of Italy and its peoples in the period from 290 BC to 1140 AD. At the beginning of the game, the players are assigned certain peoples according to their game colour. Some of these peoples are already on the board at the beginning of the game, others are added in the course of the game.

A Roma aeterna game lasts about four to six hours and comprises a total of 16 game rounds.

Within the individual game rounds, the players continuously collect victory points for the successful execution of certain actions and for the possession of certain territories by their peoples. The winner of the game is the player who has scored the most victory points with his or her peoples at the end of game round 16.

Roma aeterna is a game in the so-called Britannia style. So if you like games in this style, you will love Roma aeterna...

Name: Flu Season Dice Game
Description: A companion dice game to the original card game about staying healthy while eliminating others by getting them sick. Roll the dice to determine if you gain or lose heart tokens, the life point tracking mechanism for you turn. Then repeat process. Optional rules allow you to play with character powers and different game play styles.

Name: Hordes of Power
Description:
Welcome to the Isle of Prymal, spelled with a "Y", so you know it's bad a$$. Once, long ago, the isle was home to a technologically advanced super civilization that utterly destroyed itself... and from the ashes arose the barbaric and beautiful land of Prymal as we know it today. A land of enigmatic prophecy, where it has been foretold that peace will only return when a champion of destiny arises and assembles a legendary Horde of Power: a fabled force with the strength of 25 mountains! Are YOU that champion of destiny? Do you have what it takes to build a Horde of Power and rule the Isle of Prymal?

Can you assemble and lead an army of heroes, villains, monsters, robots, pirates, sorcerers, and ex-girlfriends, all the while fending off your opponent's attempts to weaken your forces through murder, kidnapping, and brainwashing?

Name: Aggretsuko Office Rage Card Game
Description: Be the first to empty your hand by placing Coworker Cards in the workspace to make or add onto sets and sequences. The first player in each round to empty their hand gets to flip a Karaoke Token, and a new round begins. Flip three Karaoke Tokens to win this fast-paced game!

Name: Inundo
Description:
Players use developmental measures in the form of different cards to protect houses on a map against flooding.

Each round you gain income to pay for these measures and new cards. On top of that, there is an event card affecting all players. At the end of each round different houses along the rivers are flooded in certain patterns that are determined by dice roll. Every house that wasn't protected by you specifically (multiple people can protect the same house) gives you one negative point.

After 6 rounds you want to be the person with the least amount of negative points. Additionally, there are win conditions for having ecological and aesthetic points on your measure cards. Finally, after the end of the main game every player gives a speech about their protection efforts. Everyone then votes on the best speech, which is the third component for determining who wins the game.

Name: Pocket Detective: Season 1
Description:
In the Pocket Detective game series, players take the role of investigators trying to get to the bottom of tangled cases and mysterious stories. Gather clues, interrogate suspects, perform arrests and identify evidence to successfully solve the case.

On their turn, each player chooses an available card to investigate. These cards can represent a Clue, a Location, Witness Interrogation, Special Action, Arrest of a Suspect, etc. Players will discover what actually happened by investigating leads on these cards. The objective is to solve a case in a minimum number of turns.

Pocket Detective Season 1 includes three cooperative card-based cases which will test your deduction for 1-6 players, ages 10+.
Test your investigative skills with three criminal cases: “Murder at the University,” “Dangerous Liaisons,” and “Time is Running Out.”

—description from the publisher

Name: Family Feud: Late Night Edition
Description:
It’s time to put your mind in the gutter and answer survey questions that might make someone blush. But it’s all in good fun, with questions like: “We asked 100 Women, Name something your husband wishes was bigger” … “At what age do most men suffer a midlife crisis?” … “What word or phrase might a partner whisper in your ear to be romantic?” … “Name a sure giveaway that a couple has just been doing some heavy petting.” You get the picture. So now let’s get down and dirty with the game that may get a rise out of you. Late Night Family Feud is recommended for 3 or more players, ages 16 and up.

• Includes: 200 Face Off Cards, 1 Emcee Card, 1 Dry Erase Scoreboard, 1 Dry Erase Marker, 1 Instruction sheet

Name: Cat Traveler In Asia
Description:
The Theme
Travel all over Asia to complete Mission.

Game-Play
Players will travel through eight places in Asia.Whoever has the most points wins.
At the beginning, each player has two travel cards and chooses a place as the starting point,they can use the tool card on that place.

1.When it comes to your turn, first draw two travel cards,
 2.discard the travel cards to go to other nearby places, but if you are directly adjacent, it is free, and then you need 1 card for each step.

3.Going to this place will trigger the square work tool card below.  If the player does not want to trigger the tool card, they can choose to grab a travel card instead.
Then, you can play a travel card with a place at hand to complete the task.

4.Then, you can play Unlimited travel cards with a place at hand to complete the task.

move to other player until who have got 5 missions.

after a round end,the second player will become first player.
(In addition, the event card is an expansion accessory. you can add event cards to make the game more fun. There will be an event every round start, Events affect everyone,and players can use the event to win.)

Goal Of The Game
A player completes five Missions, and the game ends in that round. Whoever has the most points wins.

Name: For Sale Autorama: Promo Card Pack
Description:
Originally vailable as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

During setup, you may replace any 2 auto cards with the auto cards from the promo pack.  You may also replace any 2 check cards EXCEPT 0 value check cards with check cards from the promo pack.

Name: Asking for Trobils: Ga-Meboig-Eek Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says: When gaining Space Carrots, also gain a RiffRaff card. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing pad on Planet Pomi.

Name: Ettin: Win a Game at the Roll the Bones Tavern Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Roll the adventure die and then consult the text on the card for the result.

1. Gain 5 gold.
2. You and your ally each gain 5 gold.
3. Call to Arms!
4. You and your ally each Call to Arms!
5. Add the top card of your enemy's nation deck to your War camp.
6. Take the top adventure card of Age II and resolve as if a success.

Name: Omen: A Reign of War – Champion of Uruk Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A new hero 0/4/4

Text says: Treasured
During your Surge Step, you may discard this card from hand. If you do, shuffle together all unused Unit cards and draw 3. Play 1 for no cost, add 1 to your hand, and give 1 to the other player.
Families: Game: Omen A Reign of War

Name: MonsDRAWsity: Game Boy Geek 2021 Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A new card with a Game Boy Geek theme to add to your game.

Name: Campaign Trail: Green Party Expansion – Game Boy Geek 2021 Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 2 cards:
Key Endorsement Causes Race in AZ to Tighten - The party behind AZ (when this card is revealed) places 2 registered voters to AZ.
The party in the lead (when this is revealed) gains $10M or 1 registered voter for each committed voter in AZ.
The player who revealed this card draws 1 extra card.

Voters Respond When Their State Flips - While this card is out, every time a state changes majority, the now holder of the majority in that state may place 1 registered voter into that state.

Note: Requires Green Party Expansion.

Name: After the Empire: Peasant King's Rebellion
Description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A new Siege Card.

All players gain swords inside their walls equal to the number of razed farms they have. Reveal another siege card.

Name: Tiny Epic Pirates: Dan the Geek
Description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A new crew member. 
May reroll 1 die. Can only be used during an Attack order.

Name: Ноги, лапи чи копита
Description:
It started a long time ago. Apparently, when someone planted a mine in the middle of the yard. Or when someone broke a neighbor's fence…

Players take turns moving cards or using the properties of one of their cards and destroying opponents' cards. When no one can make a move, the game ends and the one with the lowest sum of lost cards' prices wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Băo Huáng
Description:
This Chinese climbing game for five players is said to have originated in Shandong province, and in the early 21st century it has become popular across a wide area of northern China and online. BÄƒo huáng (ä¿çš‡) means 'protect the emperor', and the game is also often known as dìwáng (å¸çŽ‹) meaning 'emperor'. In each deal two players, the emperor and his protector the eunuch (xiao baozi: å°å­¢å­), play against a team of three, the farmers or people (ping min: å¹³æ°‘). The emperor and the eunuch are the holders of particular cards. While the emperor is known from the start, his protector remains hidden until the card is played.

As in all climbing games the object is to get rid of one's cards (and help one's partners to do so) by playing them singly or in combinations, where each play must beat the previous play.

There are five players and a pack of 168 cards is used. This can be constructed from four standard 52-card packs from which the 3's, 4's and 5's are removed plus four red jokers and four black jokers. Suits are irrelevant in this game, and the cards rank from high to low:

Red joker, Black joker, 2, A, K, Q, J, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6.

One red joker and one black joker are marked on the front, and the holders of these two cards will be the emperor and the eunuch respectively. Although standard Anglo-American cards can be used, the game is sufficiently popular that special 168-card packs can be obtained for this game with the emperor and eunuch cards ready printed.

Name: Blockazzle Craze
Description:
Blockazzle is an elastic bar which is composed of 12 cube blocks tied with an elastic rope. With special groove on each cube, Blockazzle allows kids to rotate cubes to build many different 2D & 3D structures. Kids can also use Blockazzle to challenge 3D puzzles included in this game set to practice on logic thinking, vector & space basics. Blockazzle is well designed to carry & play wherever you go. Enclosed USL cubes work as an aide to little kids or beginners.

For 2 players, they can compete against each other for building the given structure on flash cards. While for 1 player alone, one can use the two Blockazzle bars to create more puzzles with challenging fun, it is also encouraged to create more puzzles with your own thoughts.

Name: Biblical Duel
Description:
The game plays out the story of Jesus Christ. Players choosing between factions the Messiah and the Evil to influence the mankind right way (by their intensions) or overpower their opponent.

Dice rolling dexterity asymmetric game where players roll dice over cards in play to get advantages over their opponent. There are two ways to win - get maximum victory points or beat the opponent by getting all 5 cards in play your side up.

Rolled dice land on cards in play and trigger cards effects or flip cards to their side depends on specific cards:

     Landing on opponent’s cards – flip if land dice sum reaches at least value of the cards.
     Landing on active’s player cards – it triggers specific card effect – incrementing value of another rolled die, acquiring the specific abilities, and gaining victory points. Special abilities are specific for each faction.


The game mainly consists of 9 cards:

     5 both sided cards (each side belongs to specific player)
     2x faction card for each faction (to track victory points and special abilities)
     2x ability card for each faction (one of abilities used by placing to cards in play)


The game was made for 2022 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest.

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape Comics: The Alien Ship
Description:
Earth is under threat by a mysterious Alien presence. Your mission is to get into the ship, learn their master plan and then escape in time to save the planet!

The Alien Ship is the first escape room board game incorporating an illustrated comic book to deliver the narrative. Players will encounter obstacles as they read through the book, then gain access to tactile puzzle pieces from the game box which will allow them to find a solution. The pieces mirror the situation in the book, delivering a uniquely immersive experience.

Solving each puzzle unlocks the next part of the story. "The Alien Ship" will have you yelling, "what happens next!?" every time at the end of every page.

—description from the publisher

Name: Punn Pyramid
Description:
Punn Pyramid is a game about words and their meaning. It is based on a unique relationship that exists between some words called a Word Pyramid.

The word 'Pyramid' can be used to illustrate the concept of a Word Pyramid. When P is removed from the pyramid the remaining letters are rearranged to form MYRIAD. When M is removed from myriad the remaining letters are used to form the words DAIRY and DIARY. By removing I, R and D in succession the words YARD, DAY, and AY are formed respectively. See box cover.

Players must determine words from definitions and other related clues given. Players must solve a series of unrelated words and from one to four word pyramids.

Before the game begins, Players decide how many word pyramids each player will solve and how many of them are to be solved starting with the smallest word and how many with the largest word.

When one or two word pyramids are to be solved by each player, one revolution of the perimeter must be made. When three to four word pyramids are to be solved by each player, two revolutions of the perimeter must be made.

The winner of the game is the first player who completes the required number of revolutions of the perimeter and solves the required number of word pyramids.

Name: Crooks in Crisis
Description:
Crooks in Crisis is a comedy game all about villains struggling with modern life.

Players evolve and play as unique bad guy characters and compete to solve each others problems with a series of drawing, writing, searching and performing challenges.

To start the game each player gets a villainous profession and trait to start their character. The winner of each round earns a new trait to add to their bad guy character. The first to reach five traits wins the game.

There are millions of character combinations and thousands of challenges to play in the game.

—description from the designer

Name: RoboCafé
Description:
In this experimental buffet, two robots compete to prove that their program is better suited to the task than the opponent's. Players are the robots programmed to find the optimal way to fulfill sequentially coming guests' orders about drinks, sandwiches and cupcakes. The game takes place on a 3 x 3 grid of cards, where players move and activate workstations with dice, preparing meals and managing their energy usage. The first robot to successfully serve 4 customers wins, and its program will be purchased from the developer and installed permanently in the cafeteria.

—description from the designer

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Razor Crest Expansion Pack
Description:
Once a military patrol craft used in the time before the Empire, the Razor Crest is now the craft, and home, of the storied Mandalorian bounty hunter, Din Djarin. Now, the Mandalorian uses the Razor Crest to search the galaxy in an attempt to reunite The Child with its own kind. Perhaps the most iconic and popular starship in recent memory, the Razor Crest Expansion Pack also introduces some of the most requested characters seen in The Mandalorian to your games of Star Wars X-Wing.

X-Wing 2nd ed.: Razor Crest Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add a ST-70 Assault Ship to your Scum and Villainy squadrons, including a beautifully painted miniature in the Razor Crest color scheme, a maneuver dial, and tokens. Additionally, four ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly this iconic assault ship into battle and fourteen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Factor
Description:
The family-game of multiplication.

Steal your friend's factors, combine factors to new products, use the unknown x-factor well to win the game. And get better at math in the meantime.

Included: The Fctor challenge for solitary play. Who can solve the Factor puzzle?

A fun and quick card fame for the whole family. The game improves your understanding of numbers and multiplication, while you collect tricks, and steal the best cards from your opponents.

Name: Tennidice
Description:
Who is the luckiest tennis player in the world?
Tennidice is a 2-or-4-player game that simulates an actual tennis match. Instead of using rackets, you need some dice, and also, you use the strategy cubes to strengthen your abilities to win, but sometimes lucky opponents don’t allow you to succeed!

You can play Tennidice in two different modes:
1. Tie-breaker mode (15minutes)
•This mode simulates a real tennis tie-breaker. The first one who gets the 7th point wins the match.
2. A 2-set-match game (60minutes)
•This mode simulates the whole tennis match of two sets. The player who succeeds in two sets of three wins the match.

Each round of Tennidice starts with serve and continues in
rally until a player wins a point.

—description from the designer

Name: BattleTech: Pseudotech – Arcade Operations
Description:
So, you call yourself an “Elite MechWarrior,” huh? What’s your top score in Grand ’Mech Melee, huh? Your longest chain in Tankertris? Have you ever beaten the Stinger Challenge? Where’s your Legendary Duelist medal? Bet you can’t even complete a single wave of Droneroids on your first life without a Shield buff! Go back to your Maraudero Party games, you noob!

Just because there’s a war on and you’re driving fifty-five tons of high-tech armor and weaponry in a giant, walking avatar of death doesn’t mean you can’t have a little fun, does it? Of course not! PseudoTech: Arcade Operations presents ways to spice up your BattleTech games in a manner that will amuse even the grimmest and most jaded of veterans. From power-ups that can offer your ride anything from instant death to temporary invincibility, to medal-worthy challenges beyond the humdrum monotony of win-or-die missions, show the Inner Sphere what you’ve got in nearly a dozen new scenario types—all presented in bright, colorful, holographic splendor, right on your very own tabletops! Special rules provide the classic arcade flavor your battles have been missing ever since you left the academy for the front lines, with bold new battle ribbons to be earned as you build a new kind of legendary status as king of your local military entertainment center!

Oh, and be sure to load up on extra tokens. The competition looks pretty fierce out there!

—description from the publisher

April Fool's 2022 release

Name: Blue Steel Brewery
Description: Blue Steel Brewery is a "roll and write" game that puts the player in the seat of a manager, at a beer-making company. The goal is to take the initial capital and increase the size of the business by buying ingredients from the fluctuating market and producing various types of beers and ales to sell. Logistically, ales are a type of beer, but for the sake of the function of the game, they are separate.  The market prices are determined by dice rolls, which is the only use of dice. You, the player, then choose which ingredients to buy knowing which beer/ale to produce and the sale price of that beer or ale. There is also the company building, which graphically represents the "company building." The player then uses the in-game coins to buy extra beer/ale producers and storage. Additionally, the storage aspect of the game allows beers/ales to gain monetary benefits by letting them ferment. The bulk of the end-game points tends to focus on the company building, so be wary. The company building is the layout of the objects you buy; a visual representation.

Name: Služebníci Temnoty
Description:
Hide in the skin of the wicked and start the exciting game! Each player embodies an evil in this colorful game, and their goal is to get treasures from the city and return to the Land of Darkness. You have to be skillful as the Superheroes will try to stop everyone in their mission and no one may even return to the Land of Darkness!

You must place the tiles in a field. After that you will roll whit the dice. If the the villian land on a same colored hero than his background, then lose 1 hp. 3 hit and out of the round! Nothing happens, if not the same color as the background. Thera are mistery tiles, that can be go back two place, move 1 back or front, or changge two different tiles! The winner is who get the treasure back the beggining or the last one standing player wins!

Name: The Biggest CHONK Card Game
Description:
The cards list CHONK information and the aim of the game is to compare these values to try to trump and win an opponent's card.

Each pack includes 36 playing cards, instructions, 3 blank cards you can customize yourself and a helpful CHONK chart.

Rules: 

     2 or more players can play
     Player to the left of the dealer chooses their best stat they want to compare
     The highest stat (number) wins and the player takes both cards
     Winner of the previous round gets to choose the next stat
     If both stats are the same, the players tap their cards (meaning they turn them sideways), then they each add an additional card turned upside down on top, and finally they play the stat game again with a third card. The winning player takes all six cards
     Instead of playing a stat, players can also guess the cat's favourite food (chicken, fish, beef, pork, lard or treats). If they guess correctly, they win both cards
     The game ends when all cards are drawn, and the player with the most cards wins

Name: Oster-Rubbel-Kalender
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1.  If a player gets on a space with a shrub he gets to scrub the shrub away to reveal a picture of what is hiding behind to hinder or benefit the player. Obviously the scrubbing part works only for the first time playing the game. The first player to reach shrub 12 wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the magazine "Journal für die Frau" No. 7/1991.

—user summary

Name: Honey Buzz: Large Orders Dice Tower Promo Card
Description:
Available as part of the 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter D Pack.

To complete this Large Order, return to the supply three different honey types during your turn. This card is worth 6 points.

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Pickle Imp
Description:
Exclusive monster card to be used with Dungeon Degenerates Hand of Doom.

Name: Pickle Imp
Class: Weird
Val: 2xp / 3 gold
Target: Lowest MRL
Attack: 2
Armor: 0
HP: 3
Abilities: Annoy / Evade

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Zendikar Rising
Description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering returns to the world of Zendikar after the defeat of the Eldrazi menace in Oath of the Gatewatch. The skyclaves, floating ruins from an ancient Kor civilization, have risen into the air once more after being buried for millennia. Priceless artifacts lie within, and adventurers are already mounting treasure-hunting expeditions. Among the treasure hunters is the Kor planeswalker Nahiri, who has a plan to bring Zendikar back to its old glory days...at any cost.

Zendikar Rising sees the return of player favorite mechanics Kicker and Landfall, and introduces Party, a new twist on allies. Also featured in the set are special modal double-faced cards that can be played either as lands or spells.

The set contains 280 cards (101 commons, 80 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 15 full-art basic lands).

Name: Scream, Aim, Fire Pacific
Description:
Scream, Aim, Fire Pacific! is a solo tactical game of squad-level combat set in the pacific theatre of WWII. The player takes the part of American infantry and armor pushing inland to take objectives, using a dice-roll action system that gives you a guaranteed number of actions each round, but not always of the exact type you need. A card-driven action system manages the Japanese defenders, including veteran units, machine-gun nests, pill boxes and even tanks. Victory is based on objectives and American Morale score, and game complications include lack of supplies and surprise Japanese reinforcements, so even on the edge of victory, it pays to be cautious. But with a time limit on every scenario, not too cautious. With five scenarios of increasing difficulty and complexity, Scream, Aim, Fire Pacific! is a challenge you will have to rise to and a challenger that is always ready for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kolm Keltek
Description:
A free Roll and Write game where you are trying to create the best Celtic knot possible. 
From a roll of three dice, select two for the coordinates on the board, and draw one of the four different patterns in that spot, selected by the third die.
As you play, score points for placing perpendicular shapes next to each other. You will lose points if you're unable to place any shapes for that roll.
The game was designed as an entry for the 11th Roll and Write Contest.

—description from the designer

Name: What I Meant Was
Description:
Enjoy a fun light-hearted card game made up of 2 types of cards.  Expression Cards and Speech Cards.  Each round a judge is chosen to pick who had the best scenario. Scenarios are created when the judge flips over the top card of the Speech Card Deck.  Each Player then places down one of their 5 Expression Cards onto the table that they thought would be a good reaction to the phrase written on the Speech Card. The judge hands the Speech Card to whomever they thought had the best "reaction." Players draw a new Expression Card and the next round begins.  The game ends after one player wins 10 Speech Cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Path of Rivals
Description:
Path of Rivals is a take on a TCG battling game with a dexterity mechanic to obtain cards. Path of Rivals is the first TCG-style game where players must physically collect the cards they will use to battle with.

To start the game, both players will start at opposite ends of a single path made up of creature cards. As the players move along the path they will be trying to catch creature cards until the two players meet along the path. Once players meet the epic battle begins. There are four different creature types that are assigned to each poker suit with type advantages. Battling in Path of Rivals uses a rock paper scissors style mechanic that allows for a fresh and streamlined take on traditional TCG gams.

—description from the designer

Name: Build or be Killed
Description:
Build or be Killed is a solo zombie-themed solitaire game where you play as a survivor trying to build a barrier of cards around a zombie-infested city to keep it from being overrun. Throughout the game, you will be collecting cards to use as weapons to remove zombies from the city or to use as barriers to place around the city. Manage your collected cards well or risk the city being completely overrun and losing the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Bomber: Edizione Insuperabili
Description:
Bomber is a simple card game that allows two players from 6 years of age to play a football game in less than fifteen minutes!

Before the game each player chooses their own team and decides the eleven players to be sent on the field; then shuffles their cards together with those of the opponent, in a single deck.

The cards that will be revealed will indicate the player in possession of the ball, who may decide to roll on goal or
build the attacking action to have better chance of scoring. But be careful, because an opponent’s goal or the players' skills could upset your tactics!

With its simple and suitable for everyone rules, the game time, which allows you to play more games one after another, and its packaging easy to carry, Bomber is the game that will allow you to take away the desire for football at all times and in every place.

Bomber - Insuperabili Edition is designed in collaboration with Insuperabili Onlus, a project born in 2012 from the idea of creating a football school for boys and girls with physical-motor, cognitive and affective-relational, emotional and behavioral disabilities.

Name: Pentagon
Description:
Pentagon is a quick yet strategic head-to-head area control style game. In Pentagon, two players will be competing to hold the majority of their colored cards in the play area. With simple rules and strategic decisions, players can pull off some big combos and pull out ahead to win. Pentagon is unique in the way players will also have their opponent’s cards in their hands and can use them to their advantage.

—description from the designer

Name: Roll 'em In!
Description:
Roll 'em In! is a fishing tournament in a tiny mint tin. Move around the lake, roll dice to catch fish, and be the first to score 10 points.

To catch fish players will roll 3 dice trying to match the dice face on all 3 dice. Players can choose which number on the dice to pursue. The higher the dice number the higher the value of fish can be caught. As the game progresses players will be able to unlock better abilities and higher valued fish.

With a randomized game board made of cards, choose your own path player upgrades, and a few lucky dice this game is a real catch!

—description from the designer

Name: Rattus: Big Box
Description:
It is the year 1347 AD, and a disaster is about to strike. The Black Death is approaching, and during the next few years, large parts of the population of Europe and Northern Africa will be killed by the plague.

In Rattus, the players settle in the various regions of Europe and Northern Africa, while the plague spreads through all these regions. The players gain help from the various professions of the middle ages. Some of these, like peasants and bakers, help the players grow their populations. Some, like the monks and nuns, use wisdom and faith to avoid the plague, while the warfare conducted by the knights and soldiers spreads the plague to new areas. However, the plague does not make any distinction. When the rats arrive, no one can feel safe. Finally, the plague withdraws and the game ends. Only then will it be clear who was able to keep their population alive — and win the game!

Rattus: Big Box includes not only several previous released expansions and promos, but also previous unpublished materials, modules, and bonus cards. More specifically, this renewed edition of the Rattus line contains all materials of the base game and the Pied Piper, Africanus, and Academicus expansions. Additional new content is included, and players can add the new "Guilds & Inns" and "Bonus" modules to create even more variety and challenge.

This edition also contains popular bonus cards like The Judge, The Jester, and Boccaccio, as well as all 27 level upgrade tiles.

—description from the publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Pied Piper of Hamelin
Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: The Lakes Card Game
Description:
In this two player game of strategy collect Lake District landmarks & locations to score victory points. Use Backpack cards to stop opponents and help you win. Complete secret Lake District missions to help boost your score.

Who will climb the mountain victorious and who will take a hike?

A must play game for any lover of the Lake District.

—description from the designer

Name: Malediction: The Magical Drinking Card Game
Description:
Malediction is a party game for 3 or more players. You will learn magic, find gear, cast curses, create wards and surprise your friends with reaction magic, all the while you make the people around you drink.

When you deal damage in game to other players, that is translated into drinks!

Highly modular to let you customise how intense you want your drinking game to be with expansions and extra content.

Designed by Josh Allsop

—description from the publisher

Name: Hobbe Manor
Description:
Hobbe Manor is a light, fast competitive game of memory, trickery, and magic! Take on the role of the family and servants leaving gifts for a sneaky magical house-elf.

Can you be the first to match The Hobbe with either The Food or The New Clothes in a single room of the Manor house?

To complete this task requires some cleverness, because the Mystery cards move around, and the Hobbe is the slipperiest character of them all!  Your role also changes at every turn -- from the Lord to the Bootboy and everyone in between.

Hobbe Manor is simple to play, but hard to master!  With several different modes of play, everyone can enjoy the magic and mystery of this crafty BeCrofty game!

—description from the publisher

Name: It's Obvious: Free Trial Version
Description:
A tiny free promotional demonstration version of It's Obvious.

In standard It's Obvious, there are 300 cards, 8 number tokens, 10 round tokens and 6 voting wheels and player count is 3 to 6 players.

In this free demo version, there are 15 cards and no other components and player count is 3 to 4 players.

Name: Viticulture World: Cooperative Expansion
Description:
Cooperate with members of your extended winemaking family in various asymmetric regions around the world in Viticulture World: Cooperative Expansion as you try to achieve global recognition. Balance the management of your individual vineyard with the combined effort of your fellow players to gain influence within the region.

Using the new game board, tiles, tokens, and event cards combined with the original vineyard mats and game cards, you have six years to achieve the two conditions necessary for victory in the selected region: (1) Each player must reach 25 victory points and (2) the shared influence token must reach the end of the influence track. The cooperation, objectives, and asymmetry in this expansion are similar to that of Spirit Island and Orleans: Invasion.

The Viticulture core game is required to play the Viticulture World expansion. Other expansions are compatible with this expansion.
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Succeed or Die! The Battles of Rafah and El Arish
Description:
"If we are to win the war, we must win the first battle. The battle must be fought with no retreats, every objective must be taken—no matter the cost in casualties. We must succeed or die.” –General Israel Tal’s admonition to his officers before crossing the boundary into the Sinai.

Succeed or Die is a low complexity Operational level wargame simulation of the battles of Rafah and El Arish, fought in the Sinai between the Egyptian Palestinian forces and elements of General Israel Tal’s and Avraham Yoffi’s armored Ugdahs (divisions) during the Six Day War.  General Tal’s Ugdah was tasked with attacking the dug in Palestinian 7th Infantry Division in and around Rafah to secure the crucial road intersection near the Sinai/Israel border. Once secured, General Yoffi’s Ugdah would become the breakthrough force that would then drive deep into the Sinai to either take the Mitla Pass if General Sharon’s Ugdah was unable to defeat the Egyptians at Abu Ageila, or El Arish. General Tal would support General Yoffi by preventing any enemy attacks out of Gaza as well as taking El Arish if General Yoffi’s goal became the Mitla Pass. The Egyptian’s had powerful forces in the area, including their 4th Armored Division and a combined arms formation that combined outnumbered the attacking Israeli formations. The Israeli’s enjoyed total air supremacy, but numbers were against them, and it would take all of the skill, daring and luck they could muster if the Israeli’s were to succeed.

Players are cast in the roles of the local commanders on this battlefield.  Both will be challenged to do as well, or better than their historical counterparts.

Each hex is about a quarter of a mile across.  A turn represents four hours of time.  Each unit is either a battalion (II) or company (I).

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Fluxx: More Rules
Description: More Rules is an expansion pack for any standalone Fluxx game, with this pack containing ten new rules and three "meta rule" cards.

Name: Fluxx: More Actions
Description: More Actions is an expansion pack for any standalone Fluxx game, with this pack featuring ten action cards that will spice up whatever version you're playing.

Name: Fluxx: More Surprises
Description: More Surprises is an expansion pack for any standalone Fluxx game, with this pack containing the four original surprise cards, four rarer surprise cards, and two new surprises.

Name: Galaxy Trucker: Keep on Trucking
Description:
Do you laugh at pirates, shrug off combat zones, and meet every meteor with cannons blazing? If you've mastered the basics of Galaxy Trucker, then you're ready for Galaxy Trucker: Keep on Trucking!

In this expansion, Corp Inc has new ships they would like you to try, ships that will challenge you, ships that will make you ask, "What were they thinking?!"

Your ships will be thoroughly tested by new adventures, and if your flights still seem easy, "Rough Roads" cards can turn a humdrum milk run into a twisted spatiotemporal nightmare.

To meet these challenges, you'll have access to new components offering new tactical options, and you'll be able to fly with new aliens who each have a unique ability.

The different parts of this expansion can be mixed and matched, allowing you to choose the combination that will be the most fun for you, so whether you're flying with grizzled veterans who miss the thrill of exploding spaceships or teaching newbies who just survived their first flight, this expansion will help you keep on trucking!

– Relaunched edition of Galaxy Trucker and its expansion Keep on Trucking keep the best gaming elements from the original while contains something extra. –

—description from the publisher

Name: Age of Flora
Description:
The passion for flowers in the colonial period among the European powers, especially the Dutch and the British, is somewhat forgotten today. In Britain in particular, 'plant hunters' brought back bulbs, seeds and sometimes even seedlings of native species from Asia, Africa and the Americas, which were then propagated, crossbred and adapted to the cold climate by gardeners back home. This seemingly impossible project was supported by a flood of funding from patrons, mainly royalty, aristocrats and wealthy families.

In Age of Flora, flowers are everything. You are a flower buyer, so you need to collect as many flowers as possible before your competitors do. The sooner you reach seven flowers in your possession, the sooner you will receive a contract to deliver them to the noblemen's mansions - which will naturally have magnificent gardens. However, you cannot buy all the flowers. The market is limited in size and the varieties that should be delivered to the 'Royal Gardens' are not easily accessible!

In Age of Flora, players aim to collect 7 different flower saplings the fastest! However, if you wait too long for flowers to accumulate, the market may fill up go bust! Or the Royal family may swoop in an buy the flowers from under your nose.

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Gauntlet Fighter Expansion Pack
Description:
The Gauntlet Fighter is a massive presence in any battle whether serving as a flagship, hard-hitting gunship, or troop dropship for Mandalorian super commandos. Collar mounted swivel wings allow the craft to rotate in place, threatening numerous angles at once. Used by many factions from Pre Vizla’s Deathwatch during the Clone Wars to Clan Wren’s resistance fighters of the Galactic Civil War, this intimidating craft has flown in countless battles across galactic history.

X-Wing 2nd ed.: Gauntlet Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add a Gauntlet Fighter to your squadrons, including a beautifully painted miniature in a classic Mandalorian color scheme, multiple maneuver dials (for each faction), and tokens. Additionally, fourteen ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly this iconic assault ship into battle and eighteen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Monopoly: Hello Kitty and Friends
Description:
“You can never have too many friends!”

Live by the words of Sanrio’s universally adored icon and join Hello Kitty in her colorful world with MONOPOLY: Hello Kitty and Friends!

Buy, sell, and trade locations where all your favorite characters work and play in this all-new, custom version of the classic game featuring My Melody, Keroppi, Badtz-Maru, Chococat, Cinnamoroll, and many others.

Seven collectible tokens feature Hello Kitty and Friends as the cutest vehicles, and Celebrations and Adventures are in store as you collect Kuromi’s Candy Shop, Doki-Doki's Burger Shack, and more to be the last player standing to win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monsterdicer
Description:
Monsterdicer is a fast-paced dice game with a surprisingly strategic approach. Choose the dice and catch your own monsters or prevent the opponent from reaching the goal.

The aim of the game is to catch all your own monsters numbered 1 to 9. To do this, the appropriate dice must be selected in turn. Once a die has been selected it can no longer be used by the other players, so you always decide between personal victory and blocking the other players from winning.

There is an accompanying app for the game for android or via web browser.

Name: Tamashii: Chronicle of Ascend – Owlman
Description:
Additional character with its own character card, and three special owl tokens.

The body of the Owlman has been improved for decades in terms of cooperation with animals. These modifications help him control the terrain around him and spot enemies in front of everyone else in practice.

Name: Sauriana
Description:
Sauriana is a dynamic 32mm skirmish wargame from fossilpunk foundry, set in an alt-history 1800s. Players build a posse of daring agents from one of four main factions vying for dominance in a strange new frontier of time-displaced dinosaurs, steam-powered automatons, rogue science and Victorian-era weirdness!

Join the ranks of the Othniellians or Cope Collective, waging the 'bone wars' across the American frontier, delve into the jungle depths as a member of the explorer's club, or field mercenaries and monsters of the world's faire in this narrative, gunslinging game where every choice matters, every character can be customized to your liking, and danger lurks everywhere!

—description from the publisher

Name: ¿Quién Será?
Description:
Knowing Jesus that one of his disciples was going to deliver him, because that is how it was detailed in the Scriptures, and it had to happen for the prophecy to be fulfilled. He finds Judas, who exchanged gold coins to sell him. The other disciples entered into doubt and suspicion, but what is written is written, and this cannot be changed.

A mini party game, with a Christian parody theme. The game is casual with a single goal and 2 rules!

Cards are separated according to the number of players (always ensuring that the card of Jesus and Judas are there), once the cards have been dealt, all the players look at their cards and leave them face down, only the one who has the card of Jesus is the one who shows the other players, and obviously leaves it face up.

The goal of the game is to find Judas among the other players. Whoever has the Judas card must make Jesus discover him before the other disciples.

If Jesus finds Judas, Jesus and Judas win (the prophecy is fulfilled). If the disciples found Judas, the disciples win (and the prophecy is not fulfilled).

—user summary

Name: La Carpinchada Junior
Description:
A children's game based on La Carpinchada.

In this case, the small capybaras do their thing, and go through the Iberá estuaries in two challenges (two games) and train to be the new owners of the ibera.

Lead three capybara brothers from the same family and beat the other families in these challenges.

Name: Complete Murder Mystery: Murder at the Tower of London
Description:
A murder has been committed in the Tower of London.

Players assume the character of one of ten people, all present at the Tower of London at the time of the murder.  Over the course of the gathering, the players must mingle, converse, and consequently determine who is the murderer.

Each player is given a list of 6 statements that must be made during the game. These statements should lead the best investigator to the guilty party.

Perfectly presented in an elegantly finished whiskey style gift box it is a perfect way to entertain your friends and family for an evening.

Contents:
    Newspaper containing plots and recipes
    10 x character booklets
    10 x murder cards
    2 x sheets of name stickers

Name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game – Collector's Case Champion Cards
Description:
Originally available during the Ascension Tactics: Miniatures Deckbuilding Game Kickstarter campaign as an add-on or included with the Ascension Collectors Case. Later available direct from the publisher.

A set of four new oversized champion cards and the corresponding hero cards, This style of card and mechanic was only ever seen before in the popular Ascension expansion, Dawn of Champions.

Comes complete with a rules sheet and reputation tokens.

This Ascension add on is compatible with any previous or future Ascension set.

Name: Three Ages of Rome
Description:
For seven centuries, the history of Rome was central to the history of Europe. This story of expansion and decline is the inspiration for these wargames' rules.

Designed for ease of play, Three Ages of Rome offers a player experience based on the commander’s problems. The rules are designed to create a feel for the uncertainty of ancient battles. Most games should take 2-3 hours to play.  No rebasing required, can be played with all current basing styles and conventions.

Keeping your men going, even when things don't seem too good, is critical for success. Units are likely to become progressively disabled and cohesion begins to suffer. If commanders don’t take care to maintain cohesion, then they could be heading for disaster!

The six historical battle scenarios span the Three Ages and provide different challenges. They offer players an insight into the nature of command in ancient warfare. The Terrain Generator and Scenario Generator allow the players to develop their own games. For competitive games, a system of points gives players all the information needed to exactly balance their forces.

In battle nothing is certain but generals that practice their skills are more likely to be victorious.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Kein Festmahl für das Teufelchen
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The player who rolls a 1 first begins the game. On some spaces events concerning the cultivation of potatoes hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach pace E wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the children's book "Kein Festmahl für das Teufelchen".

—user summary

Name: Activity Chaos
Description:
Unlike the classic Activity, there is not only one acting person per round. No, all team members try their luck at the same time with terms represent and guess. But that's not all: The degree of difficulty is additionally complicated by the given types of representation. Instead of explaining, as is usual in most activity variants besides drawing and pantomime, plasticine is used here.

Two teams of the same size compete against each other. Each team member grabs his own card and starts to represent the term - all at the same time, of course. While you are representing yourself, you try to guess the terms of the other team members at the same time in order to score as many points as possible. You have exactly 60 seconds to do this.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: RagnaRok Star: The MoshPet Show
Description:
Odin has decided to spice up the game!
He sends you his fabulous animals, the Mascøts, to set your pit on fire!
"Are you ready for the show? Are you ready for The MoshPet Show?"

Choose your Mascøt from the 8 available and increase the power of one of your actions (soliciting, navigation, theft, etc.) tenfold. Make it go up to Level 3 to reach its ultimate evolution and earn more and more Glory Points!

+  REPLAYABILITY

+ ASYMMETRY

+  CONTRACTS

—description from the designer

Name: Lucktails
Description:
Lucktails is a baiting game of inconceivable chances.

Are you going to stick to your initial card or switch to one of the two in the middle of the table? Just because you will be taking a chance either way does not mean that you have to rely on blind luck. After all, the longer you "wait and bait" the more players will drop out of the round before you. Each card that they reveal means additional information for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Paper Railroad
Description:
You are the manager of a railroad company, responsible for the running of trains. Recently, the railroad company has developed several routes to connect the farms through the different areas.

Your task is to make a well-designed plan to sell all kinds of products at a good price and bring the maximum profit for the company. But beware, you are not the only one who works for the company.

The game is played using 3 dice. Players need to use dice numbers to manage actions, including moving trains, hometown actions, and unlocking farm rewards. Earn points by moving trains and fulfilling the orders. Players with the highest at the end of the game win.
